page.title: 16Living in Edensor
page.content:
Living in the village of Edensor means that we are always on show to the public. Our gardens are much admired and all the houses are "listed buildings" of individual design.
Almost all the residents are employees or past employees of the Chatsworth Estate and share the same loyalties and interests.
The junior children go to school at Pilsley, 1.5 miles away, and the older pupils go by bus to the secondary school in Bakewell.
St.Peter's Church dominates the village green and is large enough for more people than usually attend. Most of the parishioners support the church at functions such as Edensor Village Day and the annual Sheep Service.
